programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad

programme.title: Sin City Motors

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond visits Abu Dhabi's Yas Marina circuit to drive the Porsche 918 Spyder, a four-wheel-drive hybrid hypercar capable of astonishing speeds thanks to the 886 horsepower it can generate from its screaming V8 petrol engine and electric motors. Jeremy Clarkson and James May join forces to create a public information film to promote safer cycling, with their efforts presented to a panel of experts including members of Westminster Council and Olympic gold medal-winning rider Chris Boardman. Meanwhile, Jeremy - who has promised to change his name to Jennifer if the Porsche is faster around the test track than the McLaren P1 driven earlier in the series - compares the seventh-generation Volkswagen Golf GTI to BMW's critically acclaimed M135i. Breaking Bad star Aaron Paul fires up the Reasonably Priced Car to see what lap time he can achieve.

programme.title: The British Middle Class
programme.desc: Historian and broadcaster Tristram Hunt examines the social class's origins. He discovers how the backlash against the landed aristocracy began with a group of radical thinkers who craved progress and used their money from industry to begin a process of urban enlightenment. However, the growth of mass production led the newly moneyed leaders to move further away from the factories, beginning the trend for suburban living as a mark of status - though it meant the middle classes turning their back on where they came from.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How the rise of train travel between cities led engineers to consider how to travel within them - leading to the development of the London Underground.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: How China has developed one of the world's fastest high speed rail networks, allowing 75 million people across the country to reach Shanghai within an hour.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Marine life at the poles, where winter temperatures frequently fall to a numbing -40C. Even when the sun reappears in the spring, its weak rays take a long time to melt the ice. David Attenborough describes how wildlife including seals, whales, polar bears and penguins overcome the elements to survive through prolonged cold spells.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

This documentary about the affinity between the upper echelons of society and the criminal underclass reveals how they built their empire on fear, violence and extortion - as well as Ronnie's alleged homosexual relationship with a prominent Tory peer.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre concludes his history of formation of the British Army special forces unit. With David Stirling locked away in Hitler's most secure prison Colditz, the leadership of the SAS passed to Paddy Mayne, a man who built his reputation on the battlefield as a warrior of the first rank. In 1943, the SAS leaves the desert for Europe to enter a darker and far more complex theatre of war, where they face the threat of execution and the trauma of civilian casualties, as well as being the first to witness the nightmare of Bergen-Belsen concentration camp.

programme.title: The World at War

programme.desc: The Enola Gay drops the first atomic bomb on Hiroshima in August 1945 as America bids to secure an unconditional surrender from the Japanese, even though conventional bombing raids had already flattened the country. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Train Truckers

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: Herbert Rowse Armstrong, who was convicted of murdering his wife with arsenic. Much of the evidence against him was circumstantial and the scientific testimony remains disputed. programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston travels to Sardinia to meet the scientists and archaeologists who have evidence that suggests giants once existed. Researchers have discovered abnormally large human skeletons in networks of elaborate caves, mines and tombs in Sardinia, China, the United States, northern India and South America. However, if the race did exist, it remains unclear as to why it has seemingly been eradicated from history.

programme.title: Mission: Kill Hitler
programme.desc: A plot to kill the fuhrer that remained secret until the late 1990s. Operation Foxley planned to murder Hitler during his daily morning walk at the Berghof, his Bavarian residence. Two soldiers parachuted into the area were supposed to find a perfect location to shoot Hitler and stop the devastating war. Based on the British Secret Services' declassified documents, using archives and fictionalised reconstitutions, this film recounts the full story and the detailed plan that should have led to the murder of Adolf Hitler, and explains why it failed..

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A death on a local farm is blamed on a Kembleford doctor through a series of poison pen letters, and Father Brown must try to find out who sent them to save his friend from the gallows. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams and Sorcha Cusack.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: A day out at a local hill climb track ends with one of the drivers being killed. Father Brown persists with his personal investigation, and an infuriated Sullivan resolves to put an end to his meddling for good. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: The Brokenwood Mysteries
programme.sub-title: To Die or Not to Die
programme.desc: During a performance of Hamlet, young cast member Ben Faulkner collapses and dies. Initially the detectives think Ben died of natural causes, until Mike uncovers a complex web of ego-driven dissension among the troupe and follows his nose to the real cause of death.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: After a harsh anti-immigrant law comes into force, Murdoch and Brackenreid find themselves dealing with the fallout for its enforcers and the Greek immigrants it targets.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam suspects a riot is in the offing when a football fan is killed. Knowing the problem will escalate as time goes by, the detective becomes determined to nip the violence in the bud, so he, Gene and Annie go undercover in a pub to catch the culprits. However, he realises the derby match that will be the focus of the conflict is the last one he went to with his dad when he was four years old.

programme.title: Life on Mars
programme.desc: Sam hears his mother's voice saying goodbye, and worries that doctors in 2006 are about to turn off his life support system. When a hostage situation crops up, he becomes convinced that resolving the crisis without a single casualty will cause him to wake up in his own time. However, Gene is determined to go in with all guns blazing - putting everyone's safety at risk. John Simm stars.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: Customs seize a massive heroin shipment and Kavanagh agrees to prosecute the importer, a self-made man with all the trappings of success, including a yacht and a villa in Portugal. Unfortunately, he also has a staff of hired heavies who make the mistake of threatening Lizzie in a bid to get him off the hook - thus setting the scene for a bitterly personal courtroom wrangle. John Thaw and Lisa Harrow star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Having discovered Irene Radford is back, Gina is determined to put her old enemy behind bars once and for all - and the two are soon face to face again when an intruder at the Radford house turns out to be Irene herself, who claims she has returned because she is critically ill with cancer. However, the police have got wind that she is plotting one final raid before retiring from a life of crime for good, so Phil is tasked to monitor a prison meeting between Irene and her son David, where the top brass are hoping he'll glean valuable information about the job. Unfortunately, the philandering DS is easily distracted by an old flame working at the prison and misses half the conversation - so when the raid gets under way, it soon becomes clear they've been duped, and a senior officer ends up staring down the barrel of Irene's gun. Back at the station, Honey is upset to learn that Amber has taken the 'shy and sensitive' Steve Hunter's virginity, while Sam seems to be warming to Phil. Is ro.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Following the Radford family's botched attempt to spring David from prison, Irene drives off with Gina at gunpoint and forces the inspector to let her colleagues know she means business. If they don't give up the chase, she won't hesitate to pull the trigger. Soon, Gina finds herself alone with her enemy, and as they begin to talk, the two of them realise they understand one another better than they could possibly have imagined. However, when Irene orders the shooting of Jack Gaunt, it becomes clear Gina is still in very real danger. Meanwhile, Honey has it out with Steve, disappointed that he had sex with Amber, and accusing him of being as bad as his brother. Indeed, Phil is having his fair share of problems as Sam discovers that his New Year's invitation followed hard on the heels of his dalliance with the prison liaison officer. Roberta Taylor, Lynda Bellingham, Lisa Maxwell and Scott Maslen star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Staff shortages cause tension in CPU, with Ramani bearing the brunt as she struggles to cope with an increased workload - and when an outside source brings the matter to Adam's attention, the situation becomes hugely political, only serving to aggravate the already volatile relationship between Jack and Neil. By way of an immediate solution, Jack assigns Terry to help Ramani with the case of a man suspected of being a paedophile - but Ramani is worried about Terry's ability to deal with such a task given his own traumatic background. Meanwhile, the rest of the relief let their hair down at Lance's stag party - but when the guest of honour nips outside for a breath of fresh air, he is suddenly attacked from behind by a group who put a bag over his head and bundle him into the back of a van. It could just be a stag night prank - or it could be something more serious. Guest starring Annabelle Apsion and Colm O'Maonlai.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Lance is missing on his wedding day, as friends try to 'cure' him of his homosexuality. Terry tries to prove his suspicions that brother Ben is a child abuser, while no-nonsense new DC Jo Masters arrives at Sun Hill to defuse the tension between Jack and Neil - but proves to be their worst nightmare.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: The amateur sleuth disguises herself as a battered wife in an attempt to find out who is threatening the future of a women's refuge. Hetty's quest to find the leak opens her eyes to the terrifying realities of spousal abuse, and results in a gripping conclusion as she leads the women in defending their sanctuary against a violent motorcycle gang.

programme.title: Hetty Wainthropp Investigates
programme.desc: When her niece's son is charged with possession of an ecstasy tablet, suspicions remain that he has been framed, so Hetty goes undercover in his school as a cafeteria worker to clear his name. Patricia Routledge stars.

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's Colour Blind
programme.desc: Drama from the best-selling author. Set between the wars, it concerns a girl who returns to her Tyneside home newly married to her black husband, only to encounter bigotry from all sides, to say nothing of her obsessed brother's animosity. Niamh Cusack, Tony Armatrading and Dearbhla Molloy star.

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Poplar is gripped by an outbreak of dysentery, but that's the least of mum-to-be Marie Amos's worries when her husband Tony is arrested for gross indecency in the gentlemen's toilets and faces a criminal hearing. Nurse Crane meets Dolores McEvoy, a pregnant Irish woman who is clearly malnourished - but when she visits the woman's home, it turns out she has given a false address and has disappeared. Trixie is delighted when Tom asks her to oversee her first official church duty since their engagement, while at Nonnatus House, Fred tackles a rat infestation - only for Sister Monica Joan to work against him. With guest appearances by Cara Theobold (Downton Abbey) and Richard Fleeshman (Coronation Street).

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Sister Winifred's eyes are opened to Poplar's seedy underworld when she cares for expectant prostitute Bridget Cole. Horrified by the young woman's lack of awareness, she draws on her teaching experience, and with help from Sgt Noakes sets out to promote safe sex to all local working girls. Barbara struggles to understand why expectant father Frank Robbins would pressure his wife to bear him a son, while Sister Monica Joan is feeling sidelined - until she finds herself unexpectedly assisting Shelagh with an emergency birth. Trixie invites herself along to a meeting between Tom and the Bishop - but things get tense when the idea of the couple moving to Newcastle is raised.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Gerry celebrates his birthday at a comedy club, where a controversial act comes under fire from a group of hecklers. Sandra discovers the most vocal member of the gang is the niece of a political activist who went missing 25 years previously after waging a campaign against the comedian. Agreeing to reinvestigate the disappearance, the squad discovers that the activist and her boyfriend had infiltrated an extreme right-wing group with links to the dangerous criminal who murdered Jack's wife. Guest starring Phil Daniels, Joe Absolom and John Henshaw.

programme.title: Wallander
programme.desc: Kenneth Branagh stars as the world-weary Swedish detective in a fourth and final series of adaptations of Henning Mankell's novels. Wallander travels to Cape Town to investigate the disappearance of a Swedish woman. He uncovers a complex conspiracy behind the mystery, and is also confronted with a nation that has reached a turning point in its history.

programme.title: Gregory's Girl (1981)
programme.desc: A gawky teenager is dismayed to be relegated to goalkeeper in the school football team - but his thoughts turn to romance once he meets the female striker who takes his place. However, his awkward nature proves an obstacle to winning her over, despite the sage advice of his worldly-wise little sister. Comedy, starring John Gordon Sinclair, Dee Hepburn, Jake D'Arcy, Clare Grogan and Robert Buchanan.

programme.title: Tess of the D'Urbervilles
programme.desc: Tess's baby Sorrow dies after falling seriously ill and she is forced to bury him alone when Parson Tringham refuses. She then leaves home and finds work at a dairy farm, where she falls in love with Angel Clare and agrees to marry him. However, the bride-to-be suffers an attack of conscience the night before her wedding and decides to tell her prospective husband about her past. Gemma Arterton stars.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: A singing star turns up at the surgery demanding a repeat prescription, but the exact nature of her illness proves elusive. Meanwhile, Dr Finlay considers starting afresh elsewhere. Medical drama, starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward explores the historic city of Warwick as part of her National Gardens Scheme tour, discovering medieval buildings and the gardens of Lord Leycester Hospital.

programme.title: Garden Rivals
programme.desc: Ann-Marie Powell offers a modern garden and Chris Collins puts forward a traditional design. Presented by 'Handy' Andy Kane.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: The elder Dr Bramwell plans to open a practice on Harley Street and proposes marriage to Mrs Costigan. Jemma Redgrave stars.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Personal problems are high on the troops' agenda as Andy Butcher's mother throws his love life into disarray, Angela McCleod's house is broken into and Sergeant-Major Alan Fitzpatrick learns he cannot treat his daughter like a private on parade.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ramani and new DC Suzie Sim join forces in a bid to find out whether Terry's brother Ben has been abusing his son, while Honey attempts to deal with an emergency at St Hugh's hospital, only to find herself staring down the barrel of a gun. Back at the station, Jack resolves to give Jo Masters the benefit of the doubt - unlike Neil, who continues to seethe over her arrival.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Will's wife publicly blames Connie for her husband's death, and makes an official complaint to the chief executive about her campaign of harassment. Owen returns from honeymoon, but Chrissie is determined not to let their illicit night together be forgotten, and Sean starts making wedding plans - despite the fact that Jess has not said 'yes' yet.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A newspaper report about Kate's arrest for shoplifting is seen by all the A&E staff and she decides to leave nursing. A woman's health regime puts her health at risk.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. The siege at the hospital takes a turn for the worse as Jack and Neil are taken hostage at gunpoint after an abortive attempt to free Roger. New DC Jo Masters takes charge of the delicate negotiations, while Steve realises only he can save Honey. Elsewhere, Samantha is appalled to learn Abi is carrying Hugh Wallis's baby and Terry begins to doubt whether his brother is guilty of the child abuse charges.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian's new image doesn't work, Mandy takes Sam shopping, and a mugging takes place in broad daylight in the Square.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Dot arrives to nurse Jules. Rachel learns there is money in junk, Steve finds his enterprise shot down by Ian, a letter for Arthur leads to a goodbye, and Sam is nervous.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Tate fails a routine medical and is forced to take early retirement. Elsewhere, Malcolm receives his commendation for bravery.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Concern grows after a seemingly depressed Tinker goes missing without explanation. Lovejoy eventually tracks him down to his sister's hotel on Burgh Island, which is about to be lost to a property developer. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim's tries to rebuild his relationship with Susan come under threat when two feuding families decide to settle their differences in violent fashion - with a duel. John Nettles, Louise Jameson and James Warwick star.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Freddie is arrested for stealing a dustcart, Grandad is taken to hospital, Billy quarrels with Julie and Jack is nearly seduced by Carmen.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: In a bid to liven up the camp, Joe Maplin decrees a weekly Sunshine Smile Day - giving perennial wide-boy Ted the perfect opportunity to fleece unsuspecting holiday-makers out of their spare cash. Comedy, starring Paul Shane.

programme.desc: Lionel's script about his early romance with Jean goes into production, but he is aghast at some of the liberties taken by the brash American producers, and tries to stop them making any radical changes. Geoffrey Palmer and Judi Dench star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Second Stag Night of Doggy Wilkinson
programme.desc: Eric Sykes guest stars as absent-minded Doggy, who is disappointed when his stag night fails to live up to his expectations. However, Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Entwistle come up with a solution and soon rectify the situation. With Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy.

programme.title: Dalziel & Pascoe
programme.desc: The duo are sent to investigate the discovery of a skeleton in an old Yorkshire mining town. When they are told the remains are those of a police officer who worked undercover during the miners' strike in the mid-1980s, the mismatched coppers begin to unravel a complex web of crimes. However, just when they think they are making progress, the killer strikes again.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team investigates claims that celebrity chef Kitty Campbell murdered her husband Bertie during the 1960s. A former assistant of the couple claims Bertie was gay, and that she killed him for fear of a scandal wrecking her career - but Halford thinks they are being taken for a ride. Honor Blackman and Stephen Tompkinson guest star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: Why would a normally mild-mannered museum security guard suddenly become a killer? Jardine and Reid's investigations lead them to suspect drugs might be responsible, and they soon uncover a connection with the obsessive world of bodybuilding. Starring James Macpherson, Blythe Duff, Colin McCredie and Iain Anders.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: The elder Dr Bramwell plans to open a practice on Harley Street and proposes marriage to Mrs Costigan. Jemma Redgrave stars.

Mickie's grief clouds her judgement, and Chrissie feels rejected by her father. Sean is overjoyed when Jess accepts his proposal.

programme.title: Casualty

Community Support Officers Laura Bryant and Colin Fairfax are assigned to Sun Hill, where they are greeted by a contemptuous outburst from Dale, and Honey oversteps the line when she attempts to console a distraught husband whose wife has gone missing.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Ian invites his parents to a dinner party to introduce his new girlfriend. Rachel's conscience is also tested by a dissatisfied customer.

programme.desc: Ricky has passed his exams, but will the Mitchell brothers give him a rise? Ian and Ronnie can't see enough of each other. Michelle is concerned about Sharon.

programme.desc: A small aircraft crashes in central London, and the Blue Watch are faced with the difficult task of trying to rescue the passengers. Meanwhile, Sicknote stands for a local election.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The roguish antiques dealer is hired to recover a priceless 16th-century samurai sword stolen from a ruthless businessman's house _ and he races to retrieve it before his old mentor gets to it. Ian McShane stars, with guest appearances by Julian Glover and Dinsdale Landen.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.sub-title: A Horse of a Different Colour
programme.desc: Jim teams up with Philippa Vale to investigate the theft of a valuable racehorse, and discovers the course of true love rarely runs smoothly - for humans or animals. Liza Goddard guest stars.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Freddie receives his court date, but it just happens to be on the same day as Billy and Julie's wedding.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!

programme.desc: Jean and Lionel plan to spend a quiet weekend away, but things don't work out as the entire gang descend on them. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.desc: An innocuous section of woodland soon becomes a legendary site renowned for its ghostly activity, due to the inventive rumours put about by Alvin, Truly and Clegg. Long-running comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: A rapist, who was sentenced to eight years by Deed, is released and immediately sets about putting a vengeful plan into action. Meanwhile, the judge presides over a case involving two policemen accused of assaulting a hunt saboteur. Drama, starring Martin Shaw.

programme.desc: Jack is approached by an old friend who has discovered a diamond worth millions in the flat of a man who died more than 20 years ago. Delving deeper into his past, the team discovers some well-concealed secrets - including a daughter who's still unaware of her true parentage.

Dominic Fryer returns to Holby and is attacked by a student, leaving him in need of urgent attention. Diane later finds the girl in question has taken an overdose, and suspects he has raped her as well. She makes her accusation public while he is in surgery, just as the procedure goes badly wrong.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: It's the new senior staff nurse's first day. Meanwhile, George gets involved in the relationship of two brothers, and a woman suffers a miscarriage.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Hugh Wallis turns the tables on Sam Nixon by dropping in at Sun Hill and accusing her of abducting her own daughter. As the tug of love moves toward a dramatic conclusion, Sam desperately tries to make Abi realise she has been brainwashed - and Jack Meadows isn't as supportive as he might be. Elsewhere, Scott Burnett's wife is found murdered and Honey Harmon oversteps the bounds of duty when she attempts to comfort the grieving widower. Drama, starring Lisa Maxwell and Georgia Moffett.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Tricky Dicky helps Rachel acquire new stock, but Kathy suspects his motives. And things go from bad to worse between Grant and Sharon.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team are called to a horrific fire in a music recording studio. Elsewhere, Sicknote wins the council election. Starring Sean Blowers and Richard Walsh.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: A firearms expert agrees to repair a valuable antique gun on Lovejoy's behalf, but unfortunately for all concerned, it is later used in a robbery. Drama, starring Ian McShane and Caroline Langrishe.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim's relationship with Susan deteriorates further, and he throws himself into his work, hunting down a friend of Charlie who has been accused of insider trading. Ronald Pickup guest stars, with John Nettles and Louise Jameson.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: It's the big day for Billy and Julie at the Registrar's office and for Freddie at the Court House. Cousin Eddie arrives from Canada.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Constant rain puts a damper on the holidaymakers' fun, and it isn't long before the Yellowcoats are scraping the bottom of the barrel in a bid to devise new indoor amusements to keep the guests occupied. Comedy, starring Simon Cadell and Paul Shane.

programme.desc: Lionel is surprised to receive a letter from ex-wife Margaret and arranges an informal get-together to chat about old times. However, it soon transpires that her glamorous lifestyle isn't all it seems. Comedy, starring Geoffrey Palmer, Judi Dench and Caroline Blakistone.

programme.desc: Mark has reservations about locum doctor Archie's competence, a groom-to-be panics when being prepared for his injections prior to his foreign honeymoon, and a boy is injured during a confrontation between his father and teacher.

programme.desc: An explosion in a sewer prompts the team to rescue the workers who have been trapped in the rubble, while the arrival of a new station officer at Blackwall causes a stir.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Fitzpatrick's domestic life is thrown into turmoil by a stunning revelation from Jacko, and Andy ends up bearing the brunt of Mark's traumatic experiences of civilian life.

Jocelyn Jee Esien of 3 Non Blondes guest stars as a pregnant glamour model.

programme.desc: Baz treats a female prisoner who slashed her arm after her lover ended their relationship, and discovers her emotional patient is also heavily pregnant. A belligerent man realises that Sam is gay and demands to be treated by another nurse.

programme.desc: Sheelagh arrests a man accused of deliberately infecting women with HIV, but Leela reckons her colleague is prejudiced against the colour of the suspect's skin - and when she learns Sheelagh was demoted to PC because of a racism allegation, it seems her worst fears are confirmed. Jim is appalled when his ex-wife's decomposing body is found, and Neil is faced with hard evidence of his father-in-law's fondness for rent boys.

programme.desc: Unwelcome visitors at the Meal Machine cause problems for Ian, Grant suspects Phil is in love, and Sharon struggles to make a decision.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Will the Nearest Alien Please Come In?
programme.desc: Truly, Clegg and Alvin try to convince science-fiction fanatic Kevin that aliens have landed nearby. Christmas edition of the long-running comedy from 1993, starring Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Mark Curry.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
programme.desc: After a harsh anti-immigrant law comes into force, Murdoch and Brackenreid find themselves dealing with the fallout for its enforcers and the Greek immigrants it targets.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Holiday-maker Megan Talbot confesses to shooting dead her husband, but puzzlingly there isn't a body - and without a victim, Richard has little to go on, insisting nothing is definite without hard evidence. But then a local boat crew fish a corpse out of the sea, with two gunshot wounds to the head - just as Megan said. Miranda Raison (Sugartown) and Neil Stuke (Silk) guest star in the Caribbean crime drama, with Ben Miller and Sara Martins.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: A Home Office pathologist joins the team to help discover the identity of a dead girl found in woodland in 1987. The detectives trace her origins back to the Highlands of Scotland, uncovering evidence of syphilis and a possible connection with local aristocrat Lady Deeley. Meanwhile, Lane confronts his fears by revisiting the crime scene. Detective drama, guest starring Timothy West and Jane Asher.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: An audacious killer taunts the members of Glasgow CID by bumping off the owner of the hotel where their annual dinner is being held - while proceedings are in full swing and the place is full of off-duty detectives. Drama, starring James MacPherson and Blythe Duff.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Sheelagh arrests a man accused of deliberately infecting women with HIV, but Leela reckons her colleague is prejudiced against the colour of the suspect's skin - and when she learns Sheelagh was demoted to PC because of a racism allegation, it seems her worst fears are confirmed. Jim is appalled when his ex-wife's decomposing body is found, and Neil is faced with hard evidence of his father-in-law's fondness for rent boys.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blue Watch team is called to deal with a barn fire that has started out in the Kent countryside. As the crew tries to get the raging blaze under control it discovers that fire-fighting is a far more difficult process with the limited resources it has outside of London.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.desc: The panel members debate more of the big issues the whole country is talking about.

programme.title: The Real Chernobyl
programme.desc: After the success of the Sky Atlantic drama series we travel to Ukraine to meet some of the people who were actually involved in dealing with the Chernobyl nuclear disaster in 1986.

programme.title: Dino Dana
programme.desc: Dino Dana, a spunky eight-year-old palaeontologist in training eats, sleeps and breathes dinos. Eager to attend Fossil Day at the Royal Ontario Museum, Dana asks her neighbour Mr Hendrickson to take her.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: Lady Penelope and Parker are testing out FAB2, a luxury yacht, when they receive a distress call from a nearby tanker. A Tsunami has erupted, and a massive wave is headed for the stalled tanker's location.

programme.title: Dare Master
programme.desc: Danny's dare is take to the wheel of a high-powered sports car, but can he drift it and avoid the forfeit?.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Madcap slapstick and mayhem as the celebrated cat and mouse plot against each other.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom visits a haunted castle where a lovely gardener raises monster plants.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: A scheming ghost inside a mirror trades places with Tom, and it's up to Jerry and Tuffy to stop him.

programme.title: Scrambled!
programme.desc: Two hours of children's fun and entertainment.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo mistakes Fizz for billionaire Bruce Payne, aka the superhero, Ratman. When Ratman is kidnapped, Magoo decides to save the day..

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is forced to baby-sit Mrs. Wicket's Nephew on an Outward Bound day course..

programme.title: Thunderbirds Are Go
programme.desc: A raging forest fire will require the special skills of all five Tracy brothers to stop.

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the kitchen by Cherry Healey from 10 Years Younger and chefs James Close, Maria Guseva, and Ryan and Liam Simpson-Trotman. Plus, Stefan Gates performs some explosive food experiments.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up crispy party poppers with barbecue dipping sauce - ideal for movie nights - a breakfast burrito, aubergine curry and banana bread doughnuts. They are also joined by Prue Leith, who tucks into their mushroom wellington.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: Volunteers test two more diets - Eat Yourself Healthy, the latest spin on gut health, and The Complete Pegan Diet for Beginners, a new catchphrase combining paleo and vegan approaches. How will they rank on the leaderboard? Ranj Singh looks at the return of fibre, finding out whether it is worth jumping on the bandwagon, and Sian Williams look at the latest veg boxes on the market which use mis-shapen produce before it ends up as waste.

programme.title: Six Nations Live
programme.desc: Ireland v Wales (Kick-off 2.15pm). All the action from the opening match in the second round of fixtures, held at Aviva Stadium. Both sides were victorious last weekend, with Wales easily defeating a poor Italian outfit, and Ireland somewhat fortunate to edge out Scotland on this ground. Ireland prevailed 37-27 when the sides last met here in this competition en route to the Grand Slam in 2018. However, the Welsh emulated that feat last year, securing the title with a 25-7 victory over today's opponents at Principality Stadium. Gareth Anscombe kicked 20 points on that occasion to ensure former head coach Warren Gatland ended the campaign as the only man to guide a nation to three Grand Slams. Mark Pougatch presents, with analysis from Brian O'Driscoll, Gareth Thomas and Jonny Wilkinson, pitchside reports by Martin Bayfield, and commentary from Nick Mullins, Gordon D'Arcy and Shane Williams.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a ¬£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Catchphrase
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts a celebrity edition of the game show, asking former professional boxer Tony Bellew, singer and fashion designer Kelly Osbourne and BBC Breakfast presenter Dan Walker to guess the familiar phrases hidden in animated clues. One of them will make it through to the Super Catchphrase round, where they could win ¬£50,000 for the charity of their choice.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the semi-final of the celebrity singing contest. Duck, Fox, Hedgehog, Octopus and Queen Bee are the five remaining singers and this week two more will be unmasked and eliminated, leaving only three to go through to next week's final. Ken Jeong returns to the panel, joining regulars Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross and Davina McCall in trying to guess the famous faces are behind the costumes.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: Emma Willis hosts the penultimate round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' will.i.am,¬†Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Meghan Trainor seek out the nation's best vocal talent. The coveted spaces on the coaches' teams are filling up and as ever, there is a simple twist to the auditions - with the four coaches selecting their teams without being able to see them, looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

programme.title: The Nutty Professor (1996)
programme.desc: An obese, terminally shy professor invents a potion that transforms him into a slim, loud-mouthed charmer. His new streamlined self immediately sets out to woo the woman of his dreams - but soon starts to ride roughshod over everything he used to care about. Remake of the 1963 Jerry Lewis comedy, starring Eddie Murphy, Jada Pinkett Smith, James Coburn and Larry Miller.

programme.title: Shopping with Keith Lemon
programme.desc: Keith takes funnyman Rob Beckett to a toy store and hunts for vintage clothes with his friend and former Celebrity Juice sparring partner Fearne Cotton.

programme.title: Teach My Pet to Do That
programme.desc: A miniature horse and working cocker spaniel are taught how to shut multiple kitchen cupboard doors, and a raccoon demonstrates some of the tricks in its repertoire, including riding a bike and pushing a pram. Plus, the trainers hit the road to help a young girl scout train her pet rat Lily to do an agility course. Presented by Alexander Armstrong.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Dino Dana
programme.desc: Dad tries to get Dana up and ready for school, but she is busy dreaming about discovering the first T Rex fossil.

programme.title: Dare Master

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show

programme.title: Mr Magoo

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean becomes obsessed with gaming after being introduced by Mrs. Wicket's nephew. He decides he must have his own console!.

programme.title: Kung Fu Panda: The Paws of Destiny
programme.sub-title: Poison in the Pit of the Plum
programme.desc: Po and the students encounter a gang who want to fight Po, which leads them to discovering Jindiao's evil plan..

programme.title: Craig of the Creek
programme.desc: Craig of the Creek follows a young boy and his two friends as they go on adventures in a world of untamed, kid-dominated wilderness in the creek.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a culinary tour of Grenada, where he prepares pork with sweet potato mash and nutmeg cream sauce, and discovers why the spice is so important to the island. He also visits a rum distillery powered by a water wheel and makes a cocktail using a local chocolate liquor, and gets introduced to Grenada's national dish by chef Brian Benjamin.

programme.title: Living on the Veg
programme.desc: Henry Firth and Ian Theasby serve up their Thai 'no fish' cakes and demonstrate how to turn meat-free sausages into smoky chorizo for a piri piri traybake. Michelin-starred chef Alexis Gauthier shows how he has transformed a classic French pate into a vegan 'faux gras', there are ideas for healthy smoothies and, for dessert, no-egg mini banoffee meringues with cashew cream and caramel sauce.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia arrives in the Dodecanese, a far-flung group of islands at the gateway between Europe and the East. On the largest. Rhodes, she uncovers a treasure of trove of Byzantine art and has masterclass in painting historic frescoes. Travelling inland to the mountain village of Apollona, she meets some female entrepreneurs producing an age-old superfood made from honey and sesame. Julia's trip ends with a visit to the neighbouring island of Symi where, after sampling the local shrimps, she receives a lesson in the ancient and dangerous skill of sponge diving.

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The penultimate round of the blind auditions in the spinning-chair singing contest, in which celebrity 'coaches' will.i.am,¬†Olly Murs, Tom Jones and Meghan Trainor seek out the nation's best vocal talent. The coveted spaces on the coaches' teams are filling up and as ever, there is a simple twist to the auditions - with the four coaches selecting their teams without being able to see them, looks play no part in the selection process, meaning each singer is chosen on vocal ability alone.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: Joel Dommett hosts the semi-final of the celebrity singing contest. Duck, Fox, Hedgehog, Octopus and Queen Bee are the five remaining singers and this week two more will be unmasked and eliminated, leaving only three to go through to next week's final. Ken Jeong returns to the panel, joining regulars Rita Ora, Jonathan Ross and Davina McCall in trying to guess the famous faces are behind the costumes.

programme.title: The Secret Life of Pets (2016)
programme.desc: When rivalry leaves them cast adrift on the streets of New York, two bickering hounds must put their differences aside and pull together. Animated adventure from the makers of Despicable Me, featuring the voices of Louis CK, Eric Stonestreet and Kevin Hart.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Ruth Davidson, Mark King, Ferne McCann and Dan Walker pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds for charity. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: The celebrities and their professional partners take to the arena once more, performing routines based on a selection of different dance style. Kevin Kilbane won't be among them, having lost out in last week's skate-off to H. Which of tonight's celebrities will find themselves in the bottom two? Presented by Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.

programme.title: Endeavour
programme.desc: As Morse sees in 1970 at a Venetian opera, Thursday and the team are faced with a grisly murder on an Oxford towpath. Back in Oxford, Morse meets a kindred spirit, while a ground-breaking college project becomes a fatal battle of the sexes. Shaun Evans stars as the cerebral detective, in an episode he also directed, with Roger Allam, Anton Lesser and Sean Rigby.

programme.title: The Food and Drink Awards in Association with Staysure and thefoodawards.com
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts this event from the Merchant Taylors' Hall in London celebrating the UK's position as one of the world's leaders in food and drink, which has risen to an all-time high in the past few years. Awards include best organic producer, best family run restaurant and outstanding achievement, while contributors include Jeni Barnett, Andi Oliver, Linda Robson, Rosemary Shrager and Tom Read Wilson.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: Bradley is on the mend following his rodeo injury and determined to get back behind the wheel of the RV. As the pair continue on their journey, Barney is thrilled to be celebrating his birthday with a trip to the iconic Niagara Falls. Later, Bradley and Barney take the RV on a small cargo ferry as they head to Vermont. Here, the pair have a go at ice climbing, which proves treacherous for them and the crew, before a spot of dog sledding through the frozen wilderness and an inevitable race through the forests.

programme.title: Six Nations Highlights
programme.desc: Action from the second round of fixtures, featuring France v Italy at Stade de France, Ireland v Wales at Aviva Stadium and Scotland v England at Murrayfield.

programme.title: Liar
programme.desc: Terrified of being arrested, Andrew enlists Luke's help to set up an alibi, but Laura does not give up easily and the final confrontation between the two may have violent consequences. The concluding part of Harry and Jack Williams' thriller, which followed the lives of teacher Laura Nielson and widowed surgeon Andrew Earlham after they found themselves entangled in a web of deceit and confusion after enjoying a date together. Starring Joanne Froggatt and Ioan Gruffudd, with Danny Webb and Shelley Conn.

programme.title: The BRITs at 40
programme.desc: Jack Whitehall narrates a look back at the history of the awards ceremony, featuring archive footage of some of the most memorable moments, from Oasis and Blur's rivalry to Stormzy's attack on the government, and classic performances by Adele, Rihanna and Drake. The programme also recalls less successful moments, from the infamous 1989 ceremony hosted by Mick Fleetwood and Sam Fox, and Madonna struggles with her cape. Featuring interviews with stars including Robbie Williams, Mel B, Mick Fleetwood, Little Mix, Sam Smith, Ellie Goulding, Sharon Osbourne, Bros, Dua Lipa, Rick Astley and Tom Jones.

programme.desc: On the final leg of their journey, the pair continue through the snow to New Hampshire. Here, they meet rally-driving champion Tim O'Neil who gives them a crash course in driving in the ice and snow before they take on an intense time trial. The pair travel on to Maine, where they take part in some wilderness training, before bidding farewell to the RV and heading out into the extremely choppy seas for some lobster fishing. Before heading home, the pair look back on some of their favourite moments from the trip.

programme.title: Inside the Crown: Secrets of the Royals
programme.desc: The documentary explores how the Queen has responded in times of sadness and grief, as she faced personal tragedies and national disasters including the Aberfan disaster, the Grenfell fire, and the IRA's murder of Lord Mountbatten. The Queen also faced her so-called 'Annus Horribilis' in 1992, when family scandal, press ridicule and the catastrophic Windsor Castle fire tested her skills as monarch and mother to the limit, and, of course the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, when her slow response to the nation's grief threatened to destabilise the monarchy.

Jonathan Maitland investigates.

programme.title: Tyson Fury: The Gypsy King
programme.desc: The opening instalment in a three-part documentary following the boxer as he prepares for his rematch with Deontay Wilder for the WBC World Heavyweight title, after the first contest in December 2018 ended in a much-disputed draw. Filmed over several months, the programme provides an insight into the life of one of British sport's most flamboyant and controversial characters and those who are closest to him.

programme.title: Save Money: Lose Weight
programme.desc: The British love chocolate, so Sian Williams investigates what makes it so irresistible and gets the public tucking into the¬†Cadbury's chocolate bar with 30 per cent less sugar to see if it as tasty as it is healthy. Two more diets are also put to the test - the Meal Prepping for Weight-loss Diet, in which calorie-counted meals are all prepared in advance, and the Diabetes Weight-loss cookbook, road-tested by a woman who is borderline type 2 diabetic.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Keen to unwind, Geordie and Will head to a charity boxing match at Vic's gym. However, as Matthew and Luke face off in the ring the bout takes an unexpected twist. Will wonders if he's misjudged Matthew all along and when two boys are later found near death, Will must face up to his own part in the tragedy to help uncover the truth. Meanwhile, Leonard tries to reunite the warring Chapmans, who seem determined never to see eye-to-eye again. Robson Green, Tom Brittney and Al Weaver star.

programme.title: Who's Doing the Dishes?
programme.desc: Actress and former glamour model Linda Lusardi takes on the diners, who are hoping to end their run on a high point after suffering a turbulent week. Will it be a photo-finish for the ex-beauty queen or will her opponents grab the cash? Presented by Brian McFadden.

programme.title: The Greek Islands with Julia Bradbury
programme.desc: Julia reaches the island of Chios, where her family's story began. She's joined by her mother Chrissi and together they explore the home of their ancestors. In search of the fascinating history of Mastica, a natural resin only found on Chios, they visit a farm to discover how this mystical and miraculous tree sap has been harvested for thousands of years. After following in the footsteps of legendary Greek poet Homer, who is reputed to have been born on the island, their trip comes to an emotional end when they track down the house where Julia's great-grandparents once lived.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Maria confronts Gary about his shady dealings, Abi turns up at the charity gala with a plan, while Daniel tells the Rovers regulars that he and Bethany are now an item. Elsewhere, Sarah and Adam broach the subject of their wedding with David.

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: When a woman is found dead laid out in the shape of a crucifix on Jesus Green, Will and Geordie are led to a nearby convent where they meet steely Sister Grace, who rules over her flock with an iron fist. Even more sinister is the picture that starts to emerge as they match the nuns to a series of unsolved missing persons cases from the previous five years. Meanwhile, when Leonard's father, Russell, arrives in Grantchester, it's clear there's no love lost between parent and son. Robson Green, Tom Brittney, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Sean Gilder star.

programme.desc: The doctor tries to piece together the causes of two mystery deaths, including an instance in which one infant twin died and steps needed to be taken to protect the other's life.

programme.title: The Lady Killers
programme.desc: The murder of John Proctor, by his neice Susan Warne. When the seemingly healthy 80-year-old was found dead at home, police were stumped. But, Warne was hiding a dark secret that lead to his death.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Investigators dispute the innocence of teens supposedly involved in murders.

programme.title: The Murder Tapes
programme.desc: When Brad McGarry was found murdered in his Ohio basement, detectives suspected robbery. However, a friend led them to someone whom they least expected..

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The shotgun murders of John and Carolyn Tarwacki. When John Tarwacki Sr discovered the bodies of his son and daughter-in-law in February 2010, the only story told at the scene was found in the snow. Boot prints revealed the path the killer had taken, but the search for a motive led police in a startling direction.

programme.title: Pamela Smart: An American Murder Mystery
programme.desc: The presenter revisits the case of 24-year-old Gregg Smart, found murdered in the entrance to his condo. Investigators arrested three teens with connections to his wife.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: A retriever is found trapped in a drainpipe, having been there for more than 12 hours after taking shelter from storms.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: It is the turn of the Cook Islands to provide the cases, as Chris Brown handles a hit-and-run victim, a wolfhound with an eye problem and very mischievous goat called Brownie.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The crew meets a celebrity designer and a bride-to-be who wants a wedding dress painted on her.
